As an AI language model, I do not have any information specific to the collaboration of Lloyd's Register with other industry stakeholders. However, I can provide general information on how companies collaborate with other stakeholders to promote environmental standards and reduce emissions.

Companies like Lloyd's Register can collaborate with shipping companies and government agencies to promote environmental standards and reduce emissions in many ways, including:

1. Setting industry standards: Collaboration can help develop industry-wide standards for emissions reductions, which can then be adopted by shipping companies and other stakeholders.

2. Sharing data and research: Companies, shipping companies, and government agencies can collaborate to gather data, conduct research and share information about ways to reduce emissions and promote environmental standards.

3. Implementing regulations: Government agencies can collaborate with shipping companies and other stakeholders to develop and implement environmental regulations aimed at reducing emissions.

4. Providing expertise: Companies like Lloyd's Register can provide technical expertise, consulting services, and other resources to help shipping companies and other stakeholders comply with environmental regulations and adopt more sustainable practices.

5. Encouraging innovation: Collaboration can help promote innovation and the development of new technologies and processes that can help reduce emissions and promote environmental standards.
